title: Singer Helps Small Music Places
summary: A famous singer named Fender won a big prize called the Mercury Prize, which is worth £25,000. Instead of keeping the money for himself, he decided to give it all to the Music Venue Trust. This group helps small music venues, which are places where new bands and singers perform. These venues are important because they give artists a chance to share their music and grow. By donating the money, Fender is supporting these small spots so they can stay open and continue to host live music. This act shows kindness and helps keep music alive in communities. It's a great example of using success to help others.

background_read: The Mercury Prize is an important music award in the UK given to the best album of the year. Small music venues are places where new musicians perform, and they often struggle to stay open because of money problems. The Music Venue Trust works to save these venues so that artists have places to play and audiences can enjoy live music. Fender is a singer who cares about supporting the music community.
Article_Structure: WHAT: He donated £25,000 from the Mercury Prize to the Music Venue Trust
WHERE: In the UK, focusing on small music venues
WHY: To protect grassroots music and help venues stay open

perspectives.description: Fender's donation is generous and helps keep music alive for new artists.
This act benefits local communities by supporting cultural spaces.
